Do not remove sourced material. Do not edit Tucker's words simply because you disagree with him on the definiton of socialism. Do not take out unless you have proof of this 'standard definition'
/* Individualist anarchism in the United States */ it misleads the reader unless it's noted that he did not support social ownership or control over the means of production, as ordinarily defined
This part is unecessary because there is no "standard" definition of "socialism". McElroy is an anarcho-capitalist commenting on socialism, so the source might not be NPOV
removing section on graffiti. Doesn't cite sources and doesn't seem important enough for a section, especially not at the top. If anything, put that info in the cultural phenomena section
/* Individualist anarchism in the United States */
/* Individualist anarchism in the United States */ nonstandard use of the term "socialism" (sourced)
don't cut off Tucker's quote just because you don't agree with what he called his philosophy
Tucker himself referred to his philosophy as "Anarchistic Socialism". Don't change his wording to suit your own POV.
[[WP:AWB/T|Typo fixing]], Replaced: John Hopkins University → Johns Hopkins University (2) using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
/* Individualist anarchism in the United States */ if you're going to removed sourced note that he used "socialism" in non-standard way, then remove that he called it "socialism"
No, it isn't. See [[socialism]]: There are various ideologies within socialism that do not oppose private ownership of the means of production.
socialism certainly is opposed to private ownership of the means of production. see any contemporary definition of socialism. they are for state or collective ownership. tucker was against both.
socialism does not necessarily mean opposition to private ownership of the means of production. That's not a "non-standard" sense at all.
anarcho-capitalism about the worker having control over what he produces. It's sourced anyway so leave it alone.
/* Individualist anarchism in the United States */ Irelevent, incorrect, and down right stupid. Socialism is about the worker having control over what they produce, which Tucker supported.
